Description: A good guitar of the Soviet Union was produced by the Borisov factory of musical instruments in the period roughly from 1974 to 1982. The body of the guitar is completely similar to the Rostov Aelita. The guitar body is made of beech-spruce plywood. The bar is fixed to the body with four bolts. Mechanical tremolo and bridge, similar to the Czechoslovak Iolans. The standard is 650 mm. The electrical part is simple and reliable. Working electronics. The neck of the guitar is flat - a vintage original sound. The guitar has remained well. For a collector just a godsend. If you work with it, you can use it on stage. When sending the neck is removed from the body for safety. I'm waiting for questions, I can send additional photo.
Title: Rhythm-Solo "Borisov AELITA" USSR Rare Vintage Electric Guitar Soviet Russian
ConditionDescription: The guitar, released in the 70s of the last century, has signs of wear. Details of the original. Electrical wiring and pickups work. Guitar released in the USSR has always been of poor quality and they do not have to expect a sound like Gibson or Fender. It is difficult to play on them, but for collectors, the guitar in this state is just a find. Please ask questions, I can send additional photos and videos. When sending, for safety reasons, the neck is removed from the body.
